alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 3:02PM MST until July 28 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Moenkopi Wash near Tuba City in Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 700 PM MST. * At 300 PM MST, gauge reports indicated runoff has caused high water level rises on Moenkopi Wash near Tuba City. The latest stream gauge reports indicates a stage of 24 feet, which is about a 6 foot rise. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tuba City, Coalmine Canyon Chapter House, Tonalea, Moenave, Moenkopi, Hopi, Hopi Reservation and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 312 and 347. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 475 and 486. State Route 264 between mile markers 322 and 344...and between mile markers 354 and 358. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Begashibito Wash, Moenkopi Wash. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
